cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 130 mi ESE of Great Abaco Island
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north-northwest this weekend then north, passing offshore of the east coast of Florida and skirting the Georgia-South Carolina coast before accelerating northeast into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No U.S. landfall expected – center forecast to remain offshore

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. coastal watches in effect (only NW Bahamas)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the northwestern Bahamas excluding Andros Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Rain, gusty winds and rough surf expected from central Florida through coastal Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤12%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with occasional gusts possible Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected above 3 ft; only minor tidal departures possible
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible as outer rain-bands brush coastal Georgia
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents that could affect vessel pilotage and small-craft movements
